What are the Factors that Affect CS:GO Glove Prices?

Several factors influence the cost of CS:GO gloves, making some pairs more affordable than others. Here are a few key reasons:

  • Condition : CS:GO gloves come in various conditions ranging from Battle-Scarred to Factory New. Gloves in better condition are often more expensive, while those in worse condition tend to be cheaper.
  • Rarity and Supply : Among the main determinants of glove price in CS:GO is its rarity and the supply-demand ratio. More common gloves are cheaper due to their higher supply, and rarer items cost more.
  • Case Availability : Gloves are obtained from opening specific glove cases. If a case containing certain gloves is no longer dropping in the game, the gloves can become more expensive due to limited supply. On the other hand, gloves from cases that are widely available tend to be cheaper.

In addition, it is worth pointing out that another key factor to consider when in the market for cheap CS:GO gloves is the platform on which they are sold. Prices of CS:GO gloves tend to be higher on the Steam Community Market because Steam users are unable to withdraw their money. Check out our website for affordable deals on CS:GO gloves.

Let’s begin our overview by exploring the Broken Fang Gloves Set.

Broken Fang Gloves Set

First of all, we should mention the whole bundle of Broken Fang Gloves that consists of four separate items in four styles. All items feature metal studs and the Operation Broken Fang logotype.

List of Broken Fangs Gloves:

  • Yellow-banded (Yellow)
  • Unhinged (Black)
  • Needle Point (Brown)
  • Jade (Green).

The fingerless Broken Fangs Gloves are affordable in all styles, and in fact, these cosmetics are among the cheapest CS:GO gloves out there. Well-Worn Broken Fang Gloves | Unhinged cost around $80, and Battle-Scarred variants of Broken Fang Gloves | Needle Point sell for $70 a pair.

Hydra Gloves Set

Another set of affordable and stylish yet cheapest CS:GO gloves worth mentioning is the Hydra Gloves Set. It features four pairs of gloves in different color schemes, each decorated with the Operation Hydra emblem.

List of Hydra Gloves:

  • Case Hardened (Blue and Yellow)
  • Emerald (Black and Green)
  • Rattler (Brown)
  • Mangrove (Olive)

You can get reptile-styled Hydra Gloves | Rattler or Mangrove in Well-Worn condition for $70 only. The Field-Tested Emerald gloves cost $85.

Hand Wraps | Duct Tape (Field-Tested)

Hand Wraps | Duct Tape are fingerless CS:GO gloves that were added to the game within the Clutch Case in February 2018. The base of these gloves is made of a gray sports bandage, and it is covered with a layer of rubberized duct tape.

You would need only $70 for a Battle-Scarred variant of these cheap CS:GO gloves. Pairs in Well-Worn condition cost approximately as much as Field-Tested gloves do, around $85.

Moto Gloves | Transport (Battle-Scarred)

Moto Gloves | Transport is robust gloves made in desert-yellow hues and equipped with hard knuckles. This pair boasts a subtle digital camouflage pattern that is hard to spot at first sight. The palm side and the upper side of the gloves are connected with light grey fabric.

While Factory New Moto Gloves | Transport pairs sell for more than a thousand dollars, Battle-Scarred variants cost only $85, and Well-Worn ones – around $100. This accessory is one of the best ones in terms of price-quality ratio. These gloves can be found in the Clutch Case on our website.

Hand Wraps | Giraffe (Battle-Scarred)

If you are into animalistic designs, the beige-and-brown Hand Wraps | Giraffe, which features a pattern resembling the spotted coat of a giraffe, is worth checking out. This item is available in all conditions, and different pairs have different texture positioning.

Hand Wraps | Giraffe were released as a part of the Operation Broken Fang Case in December, 2020. Currently, Battle-Scarred variants of these CS:GO gloves sell for $95, and Well-Worn ones are worth $115.

Hand Wraps | Constrictor (Field-Tested)

Another item worth paying attention to in case you are fond of animalistic patterns is Hand Wraps | Constrictor . These brown-and-orange warps feature an inner layer of brown fabric coated with a layer of canvas tape adorned with a pattern that resembles python skin.

Hand Wraps | Constrictor are available in all conditions, and their starting price is $80. Well-Worn variants of these gloves sell for $85, and Field-Tested pairs cost around $90.

Hand Wraps | Spruce DDPAT (Battle-Scarred)

“Some people say they’re tough… others show it.”

Added in 2016 as a part of the Glove Case, Hand Wraps | Spruce DDPAT are extraordinary fingerless gloves decorated with a digital camouflage pattern in green hues. The positioning of the pattern depends on the item’s pattern index.

It is realistic to get a pair of Battle-Scarred Hand Wraps | Spruce DDPAT for less than $100, while the starting price for pairs with lower levels of wear value is $120.

Moto Gloves | Eclipse (Battle-Scarred)

“Don’t call it a midlife crisis.”

As stated, Moto Gloves | Eclipse is “the original classic black design that made Tortue a household name”. Released in 2016, these gloves feature a dark blue and black color palette adorned with bright yellow accents. There is also a yellow geometrical pattern on the palm side of the gloves.

The hard-knuckled Moto Gloves | Eclipse are not the cheapest, as their starting price is $95 for a pair in Battle-Scarred condition, and Well-Worn variants cost more than $150. Check out this pair and others in our exclusive Gloves Case .

Driver Gloves | Queen Jaguar (Well-Worn)

Released within the Operation Broken Fang Collection in December 2020, Driver Gloves | Queen Jaguar are brown leather gloves with inserts on the upper side that feature an animalistic pattern resembling jaguar fur.

Driver Gloves | Queen Jaguar are stylish gloves, and they are among the best affordable options to consider adding to your inventory. Battle-Scarred variants sell for $90, and Well-Worn pairs cost a bit less than $110.

Specialist Gloves | Buckshot (Field-Tested)

Added to CS:GO in 2018, Specialist Gloves | Buckshot is one of the Rare Special Items featured in the Clutch Case and the Revolution Case. The gloves’ upper part is made from a fabric with a green-brown camo pattern and is decorated with khaki rubber inserts, whereas the palm side of the gloves comprises green fabric, strengthened with gray reinforcements.

Specialist Gloves | Buckshot pairs look decent in Field-Tested condition, and they only cost around $100. If you want to save more money, you can go for Battle-Scarred or Well-Worn variants that sell for $85 and $95, respectively. Check them out in our CS:GO Clutch Case.

Moto Gloves | Blood Pressure (Battle-Scarred)

Crafted from black leather, Moto Gloves | Blood Pressure features an abstract pattern resembling the thick blood vessels of a human hand and carbon-imitating shell protectors, with the palm side incorporating black and burgundy leather and capillary designs.

This item became a part of the game in December 2020. Moto Gloves | Blood Pressure in Battle-Scarred condition costs around $110, and the starting price of pairs with lower-level values is over $205. Among other great skins, these gloves are featured in our Indomitable Case and Grandmaster Case .

Moto Gloves | 3rd Commando Company (Field-Tested)

Fashioned from dark green leather, Moto Gloves | 3rd Commando Company are partially adorned with a camouflage design and boast red accents and black shell protectors on the outer side. The palm side is enhanced with yellow fabric and brown leather additions.

Moto Gloves | 3rd Commando Company are available in all conditions, as their float value ranges from 0.06 to 0.80, which is typical for most CS:GO gloves. Battle-Scarred variants of this pair will cost you $80, and Well-Worn ones – around $100.

Moto Gloves | Turtle (Battle-Scarred)

One of the most vibrant pairs of best CS:GO gloves that are somewhat affordable is Moto Gloves | Turtle . These bulky black-and-green gloves are made of leather. The outer side of this item is adorned with a few orange highlights and dark protectors.

Even though Battle-Scarred pairs of Moto Gloves | Turtle look extra-worn and shabby, these hand accessories still look decent due to their eye-catching color scheme. In the worst condition, a pair of Moto Gloves | Turtle costs a bit less than $150. Claim yours from the Clutch Case on our platform for $5 only.

Moto Gloves | POW! (Battle-Scarred)

This is the most expensive item on our list, yet it is worth paying attention to if you are willing to spend a little extra cash on vibrant CS:GO gloves. The Moto Gloves | POW! are made of white, orange, and brown leather, and their design features a pattern of comic book-style speech bubbles with words “POW!”, “CRACK!”, “BOOM!” and “BLAM!” inside them.

Moto Gloves | POW! are sure to catch everyone’s attention on the server, so it is not surprising that they cost more. Battle-Scarred variants of these gloves sell for $180 a pair, and Well-Worn ones – for more than $340. Unbox your very own pair from the Clutch Case on Hellcase.

Best Practices for Acquiring Cheap CS:GO Gloves

If you are on a budget and in the midst of choosing between acquiring a coveted knife skin or a pair of gloves, our advice would be to go for these hand accessories.

One of the main reasons for that is the fact that your CS:GO gloves are always in your sight in-game, while you would have to take out your knife every time to show off the skin you have for it.

CS:GO gloves are eye-pleasing cosmetic items which are rather expensive compared to most weapon skins in the game. FAQ

What are CS:GO gloves?

Gloves in CS:GO are cosmetic items available in different models, patterns, and rarities. Players can receive glove skins from certain in-game cases, which require keys to open, or they can trade with other players or purchase them on the Steam Community Market.

How do the prices of CS:GO gloves vary across different platforms?

Oftentimes, third-party platforms offer CS:GO gloves for lower prices compared to those on Steam Community Market. It’s because Steam does not let users withdraw their money and takes a portion of the selling as platform fees.

What are the best gloves in CS:GO?

Among the best gloves in CS:GO, which stand out from the rest yet still are rather affordable, are Moto Gloves | Blood Pressure and Moto Gloves | Turtle. Check out our list of the best cheap CS:GO gloves to find out more.

What is the cheapest pair of gloves in CS:GO?

As of May 2023, the cheapest pair of gloves in CS:GO are Driver Gloves | Racing Green in Battle-Scarred condition, which costs $55. In Factory New condition, Hydra Gloves | Mangrove are the cheapest with the price of $399.

What are the odds of getting gloves in CS:GO?

According to the public data that Valve released in 2017, the odds of getting gloves by unboxing a CS:GO case is around 0.25%. It means that one pair of gloves is unboxed from only one of approximately 400 cases opened. Also, note that not all CS:GO cases contain gloves as Rare Special Items, so be mindful when picking a case to open.
